===Ahmad Shah Massoud===
===Ahmad Shah Massoud===
â
[[File:Massoud 2000.jpg|thumb|290px|left|In spring 2001 the anti-Taliban leader Ahmad Shah Massoud stated that the Taliban and Al Qaeda had introduced "a very wrong perception of Islam" and warned about a large-scale attack on U.S. soil being imminent.]]
 
{{rquote|left|The only thing standing in the way of future Taliban massacres is [[Ahmad Shah Massoud]].<ref>[http://channel.nationalgeographic.com/episode/inside-the-taliban-3274 Inside the Taliban] [[National Geographic]]</ref>}}
{{rquote|left|The only thing standing in the way of future Taliban massacres is [[Ahmad Shah Massoud]].<ref>[http://channel.nationalgeographic.com/episode/inside-the-taliban-3274 Inside the Taliban] [[National Geographic]]</ref>}}
Ahmad Shah Massoud remained the only leader of the United Front in Afghanistan. The Taliban repeatedly offered Massoud a position of power to make him stop his resistance. Massoud declined. He explained in one interview:
